info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 9:01PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN JUNIATA AND SNYDER COUNTIES THROUGH 945 PM EDT... At 901 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 17 miles southwest of Mifflinburg, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Selinsgrove, Middleburg, Mcalisterville, McClure, Kreamer, Port Trevorton, Beaver Springs, Richfield, Mount Pleasant Mills, Kratzerville, Paxtonville, Troxelville, Meiserville, Snyder-Middleswart State Park, Fremont, Beavertown, Freeburg and Herndon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
